[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/e2e-benchmark/src/main.rs] [Lines: 237-239] [Event emission benchmarks] EmitEvents with 1000 events - does this test for event spam attacks, event storage exhaustion, or indexer DoS via event floods? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/e2e-benchmark/src/main.rs] [Lines: 241-247] [APT transfer benchmarks] APTTransfer with different signer types - do these test for unauthorized transfers, signature bypass, or sequence number manipulation attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/e2e-benchmark/src/main.rs] [Lines: 249-310] [Vector operation benchmarks] VectorTrimAppend, VectorRemoveInsert, VectorRangeMove with various configurations - do these test for vector corruption, out-of-bounds access, or memory safety violations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/e2e-benchmark/src/main.rs] [Lines: 311-341] [Map operation benchmarks] MapInsertRemove with OrderedMap, SimpleMap, BigOrderedMap - do these test for map corruption, key collision attacks, or tree balancing vulnerabilities? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/e2e-benchmark/src/main.rs] [Lines: 24] [CODE_PERF_VERSION] The version string 'v1' is used for tracking - can attackers manipulate this to conflate results from different code versions, hiding performance regressions across versions? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/e2e-benchmark/src/main.rs] [Lines: 86-88] [Regression thresholds] ALLOWED_REGRESSION (0.15), ALLOWED_IMPROVEMENT (0.15), ABSOLUTE_BUFFER_US (2.0) - are these thresholds based on security analysis, or are they arbitrary values that might allow significant attacks to pass? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/e2e-benchmark/src/main.rs] [Lines: 121-122] [Test flow constants] LANDBLOCKING_AND_CONTINUOUS vs ONLY_CONTINUOUS - can the wrong constant be assigned to critical security tests, causing them to be skipped in production CI? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/e2e-benchmark/src/main.rs] [Lines: 90-95] [CalibrationInfo struct] The struct stores expected_time_micros, min_ratio, max_ratio - is there validation that min_ratio < max_ratio, or can inverted ratios cause incorrect regression detection? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/e2e-benchmark/src/main.rs] [Lines: 114-118] [Args struct] The only_landblocking flag controls test execution - can CI environments be misconfigured to always set this to true, skipping continuous integration tests? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/e2e-benchmark/src/main.rs] [Lines: 4-20] [Dependency imports] The file imports from aptos_language_e2e_tests, aptos_transaction_generator_lib, aptos_transaction_workloads_lib - can vulnerabilities in these dependencies propagate to production through incorrect benchmarking? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/e2e-benchmark/src/main.rs] [Lines: 125] [Layout cache configuration] set_layout_caches(true) enables caching - does this match production caching behavior, or can cache poisoning attacks in production bypass benchmark detection? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/e2e-benchmark/src/main.rs] [Lines: 56] [RNG seeding] StdRng::seed_from_u64(14) uses a fixed seed - does this make benchmarks deterministic but miss randomness-dependent vulnerabilities like hash collision DoS? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/e2e-benchmark/src/main.rs] [Lines: 374] [Second RNG with same seed] A second RNG with the same seed (14) is created - can this cause correlation between package selection and entry point creation, missing coverage of edge cases? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/e2e-benchmark/src/main.rs] [Lines: 32-38] [Transaction construction] Transactions are built with specific gas parameters and sequence numbers - can malformed transactions that should be rejected by mempool be executed in benchmarks, missing validation bugs? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/e2e-benchmark/src/main.rs] [Lines: 40-41] [Transaction execution and write set] execute_transaction() followed by apply_write_set() - is there a gap between execution and application where state could be inconsistent or corrupted? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/e2e-benchmark/src/main.rs] [Lines: 42-46] [Status checking] Only checks status().unwrap().is_success() - are there partial failures, soft errors, or warning states that should fail benchmarks but don't? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/e2e-benchmark/src/main.rs] [Lines: 66-83] [Execution timer configuration] exec_func_record_running_time() is configured with various parameters - can attackers manipulate timer configuration to hide timing side-channel attacks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/e2e-benchmark/src/main.rs] [Lines: 372-378] [Package publishing loop] Multiple payloads can be published from a single package - can this be exploited to publish conflicting modules, overwrite framework code, or bypass module verification? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/e2e-benchmark/src/main.rs] [Lines: 379-391] [Initialization with publisher address] Initialization entry points receive the publisher address - can malicious initialization code grant the publisher unauthorized privileges or corrupt global resources? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/e2e-benchmark/src/main.rs] [Lines: 57-64] [Entry function construction] Entry functions are constructed from module names and payloads - can module name injection or payload manipulation cause VM crashes or security bypasses? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/e2e-benchmark/src/main.rs] [Lines: 411-425] [Measurement extraction] elapsed_micros, execution_gas_units, io_gas_units are extracted - can rounding errors, overflow, or precision loss in these measurements hide performance attacks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/e2e-benchmark/src/main.rs] [Lines: 412] [Percentage calculation] diff is calculated as percentage change - can division by zero occur if expected_time_micros is zero, causing panics? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/e2e-benchmark/src/main.rs] [Lines: 415] [Gas per second calculation] gps divides by elapsed_secs_f64() - can very fast executions cause division by near-zero, producing incorrect GAS/s metrics? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/e2e-benchmark/src/main.rs] [Lines: 427-434] [Regression bounds calculation] max_regression and max_improvement use f64::max/min operations - can floating point precision issues cause incorrect boundary calculations? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/e2e-benchmark/src/main.rs] [Lines: 436-449] [JSON output construction] JSON includes multiple metrics - can special characters in transaction_type names cause JSON injection or parsing errors in monitoring systems? (Low)
